p.s: Communications degrees can be used in many ways to obtain work in a variety of areas .
The field of communications is broad and you can " tailor " your degree to something that truly fits your interests .

item.s: Find a college that best suits you .
Many colleges offer degrees in communications , but some programs are considered to be better than others .

Consider many different things when seeking out a college that offers communications degrees , such as the location of the school , the price of the schooling , and how prestigious the program is considered to be .
Bear in mind that just because a school offers communications , this does not mean that it is a strong program .
Select a specialization .
When you seek a degree in communications , you must often choose an area of or focus .
Many colleges offer different areas of specialization , such as journalism , advertising , or public relations .

Often you wo n't have to decide your focus in your first year or two of college or even your major , so take this time to explore the different areas by taking classes that relate to your own communications interests .
You can always talk to your advisor about the classes you can take , to help you make your decision .
Get involved .
Many colleges have communication related clubs , such as an advertising club or the school newspaper .
Not only are these great ways to get involved and meet new people , they are often a great way to get real world experience and maybe even some extra money .
However , some of these things can add to your workload , so do n't let it take precedence over your studies .

head.s: Getting employed in the communications field

item.s: Put your qualifications to good use .
Colleges are often able to help you get internships to get you on your way .
This is a great place to start , as internships are a good way to get more real world experience and get your name out there .
Sometimes , internships can lead to job offers .
Start looking for job openings online in a field you desire .
Use your degree to show employers that you know your field inside out .
Use your prior college work experience to show that you know how to work in your field .
Do n't give up , and remember you may not make a million dollars overnight , but hard work pays off !
Always work hard and do n't get down on yourself if you do n't find work right away .
Always have a " learning attitude " you can learn a lot about communicating simply by watching TV or talking to people in everyday situations .
Have good grammar .

It is unhelpful to read work written by students and workers in the communications field that shows a lack of good grammar and spelling , which is the foundation of the very tool that they have chosen to work with , language .
If you are weak in this area , do something about it .
